author: wadalliance
title: Grow Wada, Grow Cardano
description: Wada's approach to growing Cardano and the Catalyst ecosystem is currently unsustainable given its business model of mostly free services.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal fits the challenge setting. The proposal seeks to increase the catalyst community in Africa. Not only that but also increase the knowledge of Cardano and its related technologies in the ecosystem. This goes a long way to ensure that there is particular involvement in the community.
Various problems have been identified and credible solutions have been put in place to curve them.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the experience and success in the previous projects undertaken by the proposer, the proposal will be implemented to success. The proposer has much experience in leading projects that concern the Cardano blockchain in Africa. Plans in this proposal have been laid out chronologically and how they will be taken up in line with allocated sums of money in the budget in that time schedule has been spelled out in detail. It is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: There's a clear roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement. For 6 months, activities are divided to ensure the progress moving successively. Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal have been well put in place to measure the performance of the proposal as time goes on. The proposal is detailed and contains a clear understandable description of the targeted problem to be solved. With the problem setting, there is a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem stated in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: Wada may be compared to a Cardano-based community network of experts connecting the world to Africa using blockchain and AI. Over the years, the group has been active in educating people in Africa about blockchain, with emphasis on Cardano. Wada has also onboarded and supported the successful funding of a large number of Africa-based projects in the Catalyst ecosystem. Since the 'Grow Africa, Grow Cardano' challenge aims to increase Cardano awareness in Africa, this proposal is appropriate because as Wada becomes a sponsored organization, Cardano will grow even as more communities in Africa anticipate more workshops and outreach activities that will onboard more members: exactly what Wada aims to accomplish (increasing the size of its network reach) which will go a long way towards ensuring that Cardano is the blockchain of choice in Africa by 2023. The introduction of WadaDEX, a two-tier liquidity and capital-raising platform for African businesses, will boost Cardano awareness and minimize friction while fundraising. The key outcome of this proposal will be the building of Cardano-based technology solutions that scale the impact that has already been achieved and as a result, I am convinced that this proposal effectively addresses the problem.
f6_assessments.q1: The team at Wada have shown over the period their knowledge and expertise in block chain specifically Cardano and have the necessary abilities to carry out the plan. The proposer has clearly stated the kind and number of team members needed to carry out the plan and gives a budget that is broken down into pieces, and acceptable in order to meet the established objectives. The proposal also includes a realistic timeframe for completing the work, as well as a clear and actionable implementation strategy that demonstrates what is being done and how it is being done. The proposer has considered the challenges that may arise during implementation and suggested possible solutions. Hence, problem solution listed has a high chance being implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal comprises a timeline and milestones, as well as metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) that determine the proposal's success. The proposal offers a clear explanation of the targeted problem as well as a remedy that solves the problem similarly.

f6_assessments.q0: Wada has the foresight and initiative to transform for growth, which is encouraging. But why did Wada choose to transform itself into a technology company, it is completely unrelated to your expertise, instead you can develop your business, apply Cardano's blockchain technology, easily implement, use your relationships, previous experiences, both economically self-sufficient, and promote Cardano in a practical way, let me know what you think about this suggestion
f6_assessments.q1: I know you've considered cutting your budget in half, but that's still 35% of the Challenge, a pretty big percentage. At the same time, the WadaDEX product is on the upper tier, which is a dApp, with high competition and elimination, and great risk. Has the project been started yet? f6_assessments.q2: To get to the perfect product is a long way, but Catalyst funds will be disbursed in installments, during which time, what data will the project provide for the community to evaluate development? (a few suggestions like: roap map, whitepaper, code in github…) Thank you.

f6_assessments.q0:
Right at the project introduction, this proposal shows Wada's close involvement with the challenge posed. As we can see, Wada and Partners are listed right in the “Rationale of budget” section of this challenge. So the transformation both in terms of brand and operations of Wada is essential because a worthwhile project like Wada needs to take newer and bigger steps than being a non-profit organization as before. But the change here is to specialize in changing the way to approach the market and developers, not the vision that Wada laid out from the beginning. From the main product, the by-products under research, and the preparation of the leadership mentor partner, this proposal clearly shows Wada's seriousness in this innovation project. I really appreciate this.
Proposer fully understands the Key metrics that the challenge offers and follows them closely to highlight the impact Wada did, does, and will bring to the Cardano ecosystem. The “medium” level of Cardano technology usage in Africa is a vital clue to show that the Wada innovation project is indispensable to focus on this area. Moreover, I feel that the goals proposed by the proposer are not too many, but they can be kept close to reality and highly enforceable. However, if possible, I would like to see growth statistics more specific, rather than just “high,” “medium” and “very high”.
Finally, regarding the anticipated risks and solutions, the proposer makes me, in particular, and of course all investors in general, very reassured about this innovation of Wada. Since the explanations and arguments presented are compelling, a fully grounded Wada will be able to deal with generalized risks with relative ease. But, again, from my point of view, I hope the proposer can name a few brand consultants that you are targeting, which will increase the investor's peace of mind even more. As you know, the rebranding process is fundamental.
f6_assessments.q1: First of all, I would like to express my gratitude to the core members of your team for your efforts and perseverance to this day. From the outset, you made it clear that this proposed budget is only “fully covered by revenues rather than proposals or grants”, and I appreciate that. With detailed information on the necessary expenses for the next 6 months, and the beautiful introduction of essential members, I have nothing to discuss too much and want to commend your team. However, the proposal presented a good roadmap with specific dates but still lacked the meticulousness for a vital innovation project. If possible, add a few lines to describe what you will do to be able to complete the activity headings and with the allocation of people or technology.
f6_assessments.q2: To be honest, compared to the two parts presented very well above, this part is a bit too brief. Because assuming your project is funded, the information in this proposal will not be enough to help the community follow and evaluate the step-by-step process of completing the proposed plan. I appreciate that the proposer sticks to the key metrics of this challenge, but that doesn't mean you can just state the topics, with words that have broad meanings like "numbers" or "growth". Investors will care more about numbers than sentences filled with such generic terms. You show me what success looks like, but you give me no basis to believe it will. Therefore, I hope the proposer can add to this section. And please write a few more lines to introduce the old projects related to the new one briefly. Because the request is “provide INFORMATION”, not just the name and link like that. This is a significant and potential project, I appreciate it, so the proposer should try to show the seriousness and clear goals of your team.

f6_assessments.q0: The main purpose of the proposer is to get funding from key tenants and initiatives to close the gap until a more sustainable solution is developed by the way grow Wada. In the proposed solution that the proposal presents specifically and clearly. the main challenge of this proposal is to move away from Catalyst and fund it based on core operating costs because of security issues and insufficient capability to maintain a dedicated group. Therefore, they have proposed a solution that is to turn Wata into a technology company that generates revenue but does not change its mission and vision. In addition, the proposal mentions the main product and other products. The proposer also states the main results that the proposal has and the specific goals set forth with indicators to measure. One thing that the project does very well is that they can list the risks and for each risk, they have a plan to deal with it, such as with the risk of sustainability in the future, they ensure the sustainability of the project through revenue-generating technology products, or product development won't be an issue because of the growing network of developers and strong relationships in Wada.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal team has given a roadmap to implement the proposal but the timelines only indicate the results, I think it would be better if they mentioned the implementation process such as Wada's product roadmap. How to proceed, what jobs and tasks are done to complete Wada's product set, and which staff members are involved in the project...In addition, it is advisable to mention what work the team members will perform so that can compare whether the staff is suitable for the plans in this project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer has given specific measurement indicators, but compared to the results mentioned in the roadmap, in the key metric section, there is a mention of social network interaction in months 3, 6, and 12, but this part is not mentioned in the roadmap and 2023 Wada roadmap and product suite finalized mentioned in the road map are not mentioned in the key metric. However the success of the described project corresponds to the key metric and is specifically described as being a sustainable business that does not need to depend on Catalyst funds and once funded will develop a Cardano based MVP for the African market... Also this is a project previously funded at Catalysts so they have extensive experience in proposal development so reliability is guaranteed.

f6_assessments.q0:
According to the proposal, in order to develop Cardano and the Catalyst ecosystem, the Wada business model needs more funding to upgrade security capabilities and expand its operating range. I personally love this idea. The solution that the proposal provided is very impressive. The proposers clearly oriented vision and goals with the new approach and the proposal also mentioned the partner with strong experience in the field that could support the project development. But I think the proposal team should focus on who are the potential audience and the value Wada brings to them as well as show the function or how the project work affects the Cardano ecosystem in order to push up the prestige and quality of the project.
Wada is not a new project, it has achieved many achievements in the past and has been influential in the Catalyst ecosystem such as Empowa, CheCha Wallet, Wutano as well as successfully established the educational component of training African Haskell developers and the creation of a network of community hubs. After the project is completed, it is expected to increase the usability of the technology in Cardano and increase the influence on the ecosystem community. The project's solution and goals are very clear and it is easy for the community to track the progress of the project. The project sets expected outcomes in line with KIPs.
The proposers were well aware of the challenges that will be encountered in the implementation of the project and have planned a thorough analysis to generate initial estimates of solutions when the challenges arise.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team divided the project into three phases 30 days, 3 months, and 6 months. The roadmap is very specific in mission each period. If possible, I think the proposers should describe a more detailed description of the standard to be achieved for each project work item.
It can be seen that budget depletion leads to shortage of key personnel.
The costs that the project has envisaged include Core team fees, Marketing Manager, Consulting fees, Product Development Costs, and R&D Costs. This clear division of funds shows that the proposers have calculated and made a reasonable budget spending plan with the current situation of the development team. The costs have been calculated in detail for each job position and investment item.
The project's management team includes experienced members in the fields to serve the project's management positions to the fullest. I believe that the knowledge and experience of these core members along with a well-invested plan will create growth for the Cardano ecosystem community.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer should show clear quantitative indicators to track the project's progress rather than just generalizing. I suggest replacing the phrase "number of" with specific numbers so the community can grasp the level of success of the project and also confirm that the team is seriously implementing the proposed project.
The proposal team has clearly seen the successful goal for the project is a sustainable business and no longer reliant on Catalyst funds for direct support. The project promises to raise capital and will help Wada thrive in the African market.
In order to increase the persuasion and the possibility of receiving investment capital, the proposal should include provides other proposals belonging to the same project that has been funded. This can make it easier for the project to convince investors.

solution: Aquire funding for key hires and initiatives in order to bridge the gap for the next 6 months as a more sustainable solution is developed.
experience: Cardano-based community network of 25+ professionals focused on connecting the world to Africa using blockchain and AI. 20+ funded proposals with strong partnerships within the Catalyst ecosystem. A trusted source for both African-based projects and wider ecosystem contributions.
